title: About
text: Hi! My name is Ee Xuan. Here is a picture of me:

title: About
text:
The home page shows the relationship between the Temperature (°F) and Ozone (ppb) in New York, United States of America (USA).





New York, USA (Pinterest)

title: About
text:
Details of Variables Used
Temperature (°F) refers to the highest temperature taken at La Guardia Airport, New York.
Ozone (ppb) refers to the average ozone measured between 1 PM to 3 PM at Roosevelt Island, New York.
Both Temperature (°F) and Ozone (ppb) serves as an estimate of the temperature and ozone in New York.

title: About
text:
Background of “airquality” Dataset
It is a dataset that is embedded in R. It measures different environmental characteristics in New York, USA from May to September in 1973.
Some of the variables in the airquality dataset include:


[1] "Ozone"   "Solar.R" "Wind"    "Temp"    "Month"   "Day"    


The number of data collected in the airquality dataset:


[1] 153

title: About

title: Week-9-entry
text:
Document
Answer the following questions in an R Markdown file,

What is the topic that you have finalized? (Answer in 1 or 2 sentences),

The topic I have chosen to finalise on would be on Deforestation in Brazil and how it affects the food supply.

What are the data sources that you have curated so far? (Answer 1 or 2 sentences).

The data sources I have curated are as follows:

library(tidytuesdayR)
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.3     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

read_csv("brazil_loss.csv")

Rows: 13 Columns: 14
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): entity, code
dbl (12): year, commercial_crops, flooding_due_to_dams, natural_disturbances...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

   entity code   year commercial_crops flooding_due_to_dams natural_disturbances

 1 Brazil BRA    2001           280000                    0                    0

10 Brazil BRA    2010           100000                    0                44000
11 Brazil BRA    2011            52000                17000                87000
12 Brazil BRA    2012           118000                17000                52000

#   tree_plantations_including_palm <dbl>, small_scale_clearing <dbl>

soybean_use <- read_csv("soybean_use.csv")

Rows: 9897 Columns: 6
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

chr (2): entity, code
dbl (4): year, human_food, animal_feed, processed

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

  filter(entity == "Brazil")

  filter(entity == "Brazil")
